scenarioDescription:
The KOI-3503 Exoplanetary System


Overview

KOI-3503 is a star with 0.86 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.25 times its radius. It is located 2893.21 light years away from the solar system.

KOI-3503 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KOI-3503 system


KOI-3503 b

KOI-3503 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2021-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KOI-3503 b is 9.206 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KOI-3503 b is 1.190 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KOI-3503 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


KOI-3503 c

KOI-3503 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2021-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KOI-3503 c is 10.367 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KOI-3503 c is 1.210 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KOI-3503 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system KOI-3503, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: KOI-3503 - System With 2 Exoplanets
